generif.text: We cloned the full-length sequences of two forms (long and short) of human HtrA3 mRNA, located the gene on chromosome 4p16.1, determined its genomic structure and revealed how the two mRNA variants are produced through alternative splicing
Upregulation of HTRA3 expression in association with placental development was revealed by a significant elevation of this protein in the maternal serum during the first trimester

RT-PCR analysis showed a significant reduction of HTRA1 and HTRA3 mRNA in endometrial cancer compared to normal endometrium. HTRA1 and HTRA3 protein showed a similar pattern of expression in EC tissue.
Structural and functional analysis of the PDZ domains of human HtrA1 and HtrA3
In ovarian cancer there is a dramatic decrease of HtrA3 mRNA and protein levels in all ovarian tumor groups; HtrA3 may function as a tumor suppressor.
critical for normal placental development; different expression profile during abnormal pregnancy
HtrA3 was down-regulated in endometrial cancers.
these data indicate that 15dPGJ2 is able to stimulate the expression of HtrA3 through an indirect mechanism involving the MEK/ERK pathway but independent of PPARgamma.
cigarette smoke-induced methylation of HtrA3 could contribute to the etiology of chemoresistant disease in smoking-related lung cancer.

HtrA3 may be a previously uncharacterized mitochondrial cell death effector whose serine protease function may be crucial to modulating etoposide- and cisplatin-induced cytotoxicity in lung cancer cell lines.
Clinical trial of gene-disease association and gene-environment interaction. (HuGE Navigator)
role of HtrA3 (along with HtrA1 and HtrA2) in development/progression of cancer, neurodegenerative disorders and arthritic diseases [REVIEW]
inhibitor of trophoblast invasion during placental development
Abnormally high levels of serum HtrA3 at approximately 13-14 wk of gestation is associated with preeclampsia
decidual HtrA3 negatively regulates trophoblast invasion
HTRA3 is a target gene of the BACH1 transcription factor according to ChIP-seq analysis in HEK 293 cells.

results suggest that HtrA3 variants may play different roles in cancer development, and that the increased HtrA3-L levels in thyroid tissue could be correlated with the development of malignant lesions
HtrA3 may have a role as an early marker for preeclampsia
Data indicate that in breast cancers with no lymphatic metastasis, the expression of HtrA3 was lower in patients with estrogen receptor (ER)- and progesterone receptor (PR)-positive tumors.
HtrA1 and HtrA3 are crucial for trophoblast-decidual cell interaction in the control of trophoblast invasion.
Data indicate that the levels of high temperature requirement factor A3 (HtrA3)protein were lower in all subtypes of ovarian cancer and the lowest levels of HtrA3 were in epithelial ovarian cancer.
HtrA3 is likely to be associated with the acquisition of the invasive phenotype in oral squamous cell carcinoma cells and may be a potential prognostic marker for oral cance
New insights into the structure and function of DeltaN-HtrA3, which seems to have a unique combination of features among human HtrA proteases.
HTRA3 suppresses tumor cell invasiveness and may serve as a prognostic biomarker for postoperative recurrence or survival in NSCLC

Removal of the 6 additional LB loop residues caused a complete loss of the proper trimeric structure. Impairing their interactions with the PDZ domain decreased the amount of the trimers. The LB loop helps stabilize the DeltaN-HtrA3L oligomer structure suggesting involvement of the LB-PDZ interactions in the stabilization. A monomeric form of the DeltaN-HtrA3L is proteolytically inactive.

Study demonstrated that in women serum levels of HtrA3 during early pregnancy were significantly lower in IUGR pregnancies, establishing an association between lower HtrA3 levels and placental insufficiency.
HtrA3 expression in the peritumoral stroma of patients with stage II colorectal cancer is associated with high-grade tumor budding and may be a novel marker of poor outcome.
Our findings demonstrated a novel pro-apoptotic role of HTRA3 in pancreatic cancer cells via inducing Bax.

The HtrA1-PDZ and HtrA4-PDZ as well as HtrA2-PDZ and HtrA3-PDZ respond similarly to different halogen substitutions of peptide; -Br substitution at R2-position and -I substitution at R4-position are most effective in improving peptide selectivity for HtrA1-PDZ/HtrA4-PDZ and HtrA2-PDZ/HtrA3-PDZ, respectively; -F substitution would not address substantial effect on peptide selectivity for all the 4 domains
results indicate that actin, beta-tubulin, vimentin, and TCP1alpha are HtrA3 cellular partners and suggest that HtrA3 may influence cytoskeleton dynamics.
Hypoxia is responsible for the reduction of HtrA3 which in turn promotes endometrial cancer progression.
Low HTRA3 expression is associated with Metastasis in Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer.
Low expression of HtrA3 at 15 weeks is associated with, and may be useful for, the early detection of late-onset preeclampsia development and small for gestational age birth.

Knockdown of linc00467 altered the expression of downstream genes, including HtrA serine peptidase 3 (HTRA3), and RNA immunoprecipitation and chromatin immunoprecipitation assays indicated that linc00467 recruited EZH2 to the HTRA3 promoter to inhibit its expression.
HtrA3 isoforms stimulate drug-induced apoptotic death of lung cancer cells via XIAP cleavage.

This study reports allosteric modulation of Human HtrA3 (High temperature requirement protease A3) enzyme activity for the first time. A novel non-classical allosteric ligand binding pocket mediates allostery in HtrA3.

Our study also reports an intricate ligand-induced allosteric switch, which redefines the existing hypothesis of HtrA3 activation besides opening up avenues for modulating protease activity favorably through suitable effector molecules.
Expression of HTRA Genes and Its Association with Microsatellite Instability and Survival of Patients with Colorectal Cancer.
Hsa-miR-494-3p attenuates gene HtrA3 transcription to increase inflammatory response in hypoxia/reoxygenation HK2 Cells.
Study on the Correlation between the Levels of HtrA3 and TGF-beta2 in Late Pregnancy and Preeclampsia.
mmu-lncRNA 121686/hsa-lncRNA 520657 induced by METTL3 drive the progression of AKI by targeting miR-328-5p/HtrA3 signaling axis.
A Pan-Cancer Analysis to Provide Insight into the Immunological Role and Prognostic Value of HTRA3.
HtrA3: a promising prognostic biomarker and therapeutic target for head and neck squamous cell carcinoma.

BP.term: negative regulation of transforming growth factor beta receptor signaling pathway
negative regulation of BMP signaling pathway

interpro.desc: Growth factor receptor cysteine-rich domain superfamily

name: HtrA serine peptidase 3
summary: Enables endopeptidase activity; identical protein binding activity; and serine-type peptidase activity. Involved in proteolysis. Predicted to be located in extracellular region. [provided by Alliance of Genome Resources, Apr 2022]
